64-bit version of Evildesk

I have manually installed some of the files from the 64-bit Evildesk 0.9.0 distribution for use as a GUI shell with WinPE 3.0 [Windows 7 based]. It works reasonably well but there are a few minor, mostly cosmetic but workable, incompatibilities.

Now that Evildesk has become open source, I hope other developers will be willing to continue its development.

Is there any way that I could encourage others to pick-up on this project?

A response would be greatly appreciated.

TiA

wingtipschu@yahoo.com

Perfect ap

Thx Wez for your shell! It's has everything I've been looking for. Simple, soo fast, and really looking so great ('cause of simplicity). I've been working at your shell for 2 months and haven't noticed any important problem (and if I noticed it's able to be fixed).

Only two mistakes:

- application trays don't hide if I end them. It's able to fix it by restarting shell (it's not problem), but then some trays of working programs aren't showed again.

- there is problem with applications with transparent look, for example foobar. It's hanging up when I change desks. But You can fix it by denying transparency. Everything works good now :)

Thx Wez once again!
